body.p:
Yours of the 27 Ult. I duly recd &
regret my not being enabled to answer
sooner & even now I am Compeld to
write in haste having to attend a
Bris this morning. My Letter of the
14th Sept was before you

Regarding the Revd H A Henry
I have read attentively all you say
of that Gentleman and altho I would
prefer defering to enter into any Immediate
Correspondence with the Revd Gentleman
as this moment still I should very
much like to learn his popularity, exact
capacity & what salary He would require
I notice your having Inserted in this
month Occident my Advertisement it
is well & as we are now open to all aplicants
would it not be as well to wait & see who
may desire the office perhaps the Gentleman
himself may think proper to address me
altho I fully agree with yourself that
$1.000 is but a small salary for a
capable minister to live respectable
with. On next Sunday I shall hold the

Election for officers to serve the ensuing year
like many other Congregations we have many
members who pay but little attention to their
religion or who evince less Interest in the
affairs of the Congregation For many years
I have served in various capacities and
although from a few ? now Number
nearly 200 members still the same
apathy exists now particularly on the part of
those Engaged in extensive Commerce. I
have generally found the whole Burden of
the affairs of the Congregation devol? on
myself I am very sensitive of want of
Energy on the part of those who I consider should
take that Interest required the whole Burden falling on me is too much for my weak Con
-stitution justice to myself & family Compels
me against the wishes of our members to
accept no office at least for the present.
Who they will Elect I know not Vanity aside
they have not one amongst them that will
work & use his every Endeavour as I have
done to promote an Interest in our
Holy Religion & to raise them in the Estimation of our Community In
this hasty scrawl I cannot attempt
to say half what I could wish but what
I wish to convey to you is this: I should
prefer no action in opening correspondence

body.p:
with any minister until after the Election
when that is past P. S. I will address
you again. You can form no Idea of the
duties of a Parnass in the City one half of
my time is occupied with the Service of the Congregation
I have now a list out for signatures
to close our stores on Hebrew If I succeed I
shall Indeed be happy I am sorry to say
hardly an Isrealite Heb keep their Sabbath what
a field for Comment is this on the part of the
other denominations. after the Election I shall
have more leisure (being determined not to
accept offise again) & then I will address
you more at length

The ship Milan is in port & tomorrow no
doubt I shall be in receipt of your
Books & will Cr? you accordingly
Many of the Pourtigesee members & also
DeSilva find fault with your Books. “Too lean”
says one “not correct &c,” says another & yet they have no
Preyer Books amongst them. Its strange.
If none were here on sale all would want
Here they are cheaper than they could send for
them none will Buy.
